en: He is no longer a member of our club.
ko: 걔 이제 우리 동아리 회원 아니야.

en: Now that he has quit his job, I can't depend on him.
ko: 걔가 일을 그만둬서 이제 의지할 수가 없어.

en: He should have finished it by now.
Has he gone already?
He is beyond hope.
He had already gone.
He has already gone home.
Has he returned yet?
Is he back already?
It is time he went to school.
He made a gesture of impatience.
ko: 걔 좀 짜증 난다는 듯이 몸짓을 하더라고.

en: He is over the hill, you know.
He couldn't overcome the desire for another cigarette.
ko: 담배 한 대 더 피우고 싶은 걸 못 참더라고.

en: He lit another cigarette, but immediately put it out.
ko: 담배 하나 더 불 붙이더니 바로 끄더라.

en: He signed on for another year.
He is eager to meet her again.
ko: 걔 그녀를 다시 만나고 싶어 안달 났어.

en: I wonder if he dares try again.
ko: 걔가 과연 다시 도전할 용기가 있을까?

en: They made him do the work again.
He will be ruined for life.
He is no longer the shy boy he was.
ko: 걔 옛날의 그 수줍음 많던 애가 아니야.

en: He is now almost as tall as his father is.
ko: 걔 이제 거의 아빠 키만큼 컸어.

en: He's already left.
He barely escaped being hit and killed by a car.
It is all over with him.
It is about time he got settled down.
ko: 걔도 이제 슬슬 정착할 때 됐지.

en: He is expected to come home soon.
He does not live there any more.
He got quite well.
He was almost asleep.
He will soon come back.
It will not be long before he leaves the hospital.
He is hard on fifty.
He is already here.
He ought to have arrived here.
He is no longer living here.
He no longer works here.
ko: 걔 이제 여기서 일 안 해.

en: He doesn't work here anymore.
ko: 걔 더 이상 여기서 일 안 해.

en: He was completely fagged out.
He will come back in another two weeks.
He has been on sick leave for a month now.
ko: 걔 지금 한 달째 병가 중이야.

en: He avoids all troublesome tasks.
He began to whistle a tune.
He's two years older than Mary is.
He pasted the notice on the door.
He seldom writes to his parents.
ko: 걔 부모님한테 거의 연락 안 해.

en: Seldom does he get angry.
He seldom gets angry.
He almost never gets angry.
He rarely gets angry.
He seldom writes to his father.
ko: 걔는 아버지한테 편지를 거의 안 써요.

en: He hardly ever works.
He rarely gives up.
He has seldom had a meal with his family.
ko: 걔는 가족이랑 밥을 거의 안 먹어 봤어요.

en: He scarcely ever watches TV.
Seldom did he visit there.
He seldom went there.
He rarely went there.
He almost never went there.
ko: 걔는 거기 거의 한 번도 안 갔어요.

en: He rarely gives in, confronted with difficulties.
ko: 걔는 어려움에 처해도 좀처럼 굴복하지 않아요.

en: He is making great progress in English.
ko: 걔 영어 실력이 엄청 늘고 있어요.

en: He was appointed Japanese minister to Mexico.
I met her during my stay in Mexico.
He pronounces English words in Spanish fashion because he is a Mexican.
ko: 걔는 멕시코 사람이라서 영어 단어를 스페인어 식으로 발음해요.

en: He has a lot of difficulty seeing without his glasses.
ko: 걔는 안경 없으면 앞이 거의 안 보여요.

en: Even with his glasses, he doesn't see very well.
ko: 걔는 안경을 써도 잘 안 보여요.

en: He wore glasses.
He was wearing glasses.
He has a maid to wait on him.
He has a maid.
He employs a maid.

He put the ring on Mary's finger.
ko: 그가 메리 손가락에 반지를 끼워 줬어요.

en: He is Mary's brother, I should think.

ko: 걔는 메리한테 왜 생일 파티에 늦었는지 설명해 줬어요.

en: He's head over heels in love with Mary.
He sent a card to Mary.
Did he go to see Mary?

ko: 걔 오늘 오후에 메리랑 데이트가 있어요.

en: He was sitting between Mary and Tom.
ko: 걔는 메리랑 톰 사이에 앉아 있었어요.

en: He finally realized that Mary had made a fool of him.
ko: 걔는 결국 메리가 자기를 바보로 만들었다는 걸 깨달았어요.

en: He wished Mary had told him the story.
ko: 걔는 메리가 그 이야기를 해 줬으면 좋았을 텐데 하고 생각했어요.

en: He courted disaster by reckless driving.
He gave me everything but took nothing in return.
ko: 걔는 저한테 모든 걸 줬지만 아무것도 돌려받지 않았어요.

en: He knows the art of making people feel at home.
ko: 걔는 사람들을 편하게 해 주는 법을 알아요.

en: He makes everybody feel at ease.
He ran the fastest of all.
He was laughed at by everybody.
Everyone laughed at him.
He is well spoken of by everybody.

He has been loved by all.
He came after everybody had come.
ko: 걔는 사람들이 다 오고 나서야 왔어요.

en: He spoke slowly enough for everyone to understand.
ko: 걔는 모두가 이해할 수 있게 천천히 말했어요.

en: He wanted to be respected by everybody.
He is liked by everybody.

ko: 제가 거기 있는 걸 보고 다들 깜짝 놀랐어요.

en: He drank a whole bottle of milk.
ko: 걔는 우유 한 병을 다 마셨어요.

en: He is proud of being a musician.
ko: 걔는 자기가 뮤지션인 걸 되게 자랑스러워해.

en: He didn't know the fact that everyone knew.
He is a tin god.
ko: 걔는 자기가 뭐라도 되는 줄 알아.

en: He stuck a meatball with his fork.
He was fairly caught in the trap.

ko: 걔는 너무 쉽게 속아서 그 여자한테 돈을 줬어.

en: He is kind to those around him.

ko: 걔는 종종 하루 종일 나가 있곤 해.

en: He talks as if he were an old man.

ko: 걔는 마치 꿈을 꾸는 것 같은 기분이었어.

en: It seems like he had never met his father before.

en: He looks as if he were ill.

en: He speaks as if he knew the criminal.

en: He went to the seaside only to be drowned.

en: He was so childish that he couldn't resist temptation.

en: Because he was just like a child, he yielded to temptation.

en: He behaved as if he were crazy.

en: He speaks as though he knew everything.
ko: 걔는 자기가 다 안다는 듯이 말해.

en: He acts as if he were a king.

en: He speaks English as well as though he were an Englishman.

en: He speaks as if he had read the book before.
